body:
Can you show me the complete network diagram to understand the architecture?
Also is there any way to run those nodes and validators locally?
Would be good if you could publish the code...

On Sat, 27 May 2017 at 12:07 AM, Michael <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @ambatigan <https://github.com/ambatigan>, thanks for letting me know
> that you are having this issue too. I just noticed that this started
> happening not so long ago. Yes, I need to upgrade the version of IPFS. It
> has been on my todo list as the version (0.4.5) is quite a few months old
> now.
> In this simple test network, I am using 4 Tendermint validators hosted in
> Google Engine Cluster, plus one IPFS node. Your node needs to register with
> this IPFS cloud node in order for it to be discoverable through the IPFS
> DHT Routing logic.
> Let me do further investigations to track down the root cause. I'm also
> sure there is a better way of configuring the swarm.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/autocontracts/permissioned-blocks/issues/1#issuecomment-304358198>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AACx3L2uVSx7HKffWXr37whiBbLNLmLSks5r9xwGgaJpZM4NmimT>
> .
>
-- 
Sent from my iPhone

-- 
______________________________________________________________

OK. I've fixed the issue. One of the VM's had crashed. The swarm is only using "g1-small" machines in the google cloud setup. I upgraded that so it can take the load.

I hope to publish more documentation soon... network diagrams etc.

The decision to open source the code and the time of when is still pending...

Thanks, I'm able to run the demo now!! Glad you fixed it.
Looking forward to the other documentation and see if it is open sourced...
Basically, i would want to run your app using hyprledger fabric, tendermint
and ipfs.... I would like to take your help if you are willing to
share....offline... My email id: ganga.ambati@gmail.com

https://coral-test-v1.appspot.com/device-key, it is not showing up in my
http://x.x.x.x:3001/ url...

I'm using the ethermint. This bypasses the ethereum proof of work consensus engine and a remote connection is made to the tendermint consensus engine in order to validate transactions.
